author: Lucy White
description: Home Secretary Shabana Mahmood will on Monday unveil sweeping changes to the UK asylum system, including Danish-style proposals to limit the time refugees can stay in the country, according to sources with knowledge of the plans.
title: Refugees in UK to Face Time-Limited Stays in Border Clampdown

author: Madlin Mekelburg, Jef Feeley
description: A judge rejected for now a bid by Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton to bar Tylenol-maker Kenvue Inc. from marketing its over-the-counter pain medication as being safe for pregnant women within the state.
title: Judge Denies Texas Bid for Bar on Tylenol Marketing in State

author: Erik Larson
description: The Trump administration on Friday appealed a judge’s order that permanently blocked the president’s effort to deploy National Guard troops to Portland, Oregon, to counter protests against his immigration crackdown.
title: Trump Administration Appeals Block on Portland Troop Deployment

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: Some Republicans are pushing back on visas and foreign students.
title: Trump Tries a Balancing Act on Immigration With H-1B Visa Comments

author: Courtney McBride
description: The Trump administration has approved the possible sale of as much as $3.5 billion in standard missiles to Germany, which is working to increase its own military capabilities.
title: Germany Aims to Buy as Much as $3.5 Billion in RTX Missiles

author: Zach C Cohen, Lillianna Byington
description: President Donald Trump pulled his nominee to be the IRS’s top attorney days after getting blowback from a prominent member of his political movement, derailing plans to confirm the longtime tax lawyer next week.
title: Trump Pulls IRS Top Lawyer Nomination After Loomer Blast

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US built support in the United Nations for a resolution backing President Donald Trump’s Gaza peace plan, as fellow veto-wielding superpower Russia pushes an alternative draft at the Security Council.
title: US Rallies UN Support for Trump Gaza Plan As Russia Pushes Rival

author: Steven T. Dennis
description: A group of moderate House Republicans on Friday urged Senate leaders from both parties to help negotiate a broadly acceptable deal to address the impending expiration of health care subsidies, saying failure to do so “would risk real harm to those we represent.”
title: House GOP Moderates Urge Deal on Expiring Health Care Subsidies

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Josh Wingrove
description: President Donald Trump is expected to reach an agreement with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman that would allow the kingdom to purchase F-35 stealth planes, according to an administration official.
title: Trump Likely to Sell F-35 Fighters to Saudis, US Official Says

author: Josh Wingrove, Hadriana Lowenkron
description: President Donald Trump is slated to sign an order on Friday reducing tariffs on beef, tomatoes, coffee and bananas, according to a White House official, a move aimed at lowering costs on groceries as the administration faces pressure from voters to cut prices on everyday goods.
title: Trump Set to Cut Tariffs on Beef, Tomatoes as Prices Vex Voters

author: Sarah Jacob, Foster Wong
description: Nexperia rejected a claim by its Chinese unit that it was interfering with production by blocking wafer supplies, as a feud within the Dutch company rages even after Beijing took steps to restore supplies of the vital automotive components.
title: Nexperia Feud Rages as Dutch Company Refutes Chinese Accusations

author: Philip Aldrick, Irina Anghel
description: Rachel Reeves has boxed herself into a corner and left the UK government exposed to future fiscal shocks, economists warned, after the Chancellor of the Exchequer backtracked on plans to break Labour’s election manifesto by raising income tax.
title: Reeves’ Latest Reversal Leaves Britain Exposed to Next Crisis

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: Argentine President Javier Milei finally has his trade deal with Donald Trump, but the libertarian leader’s political victory also represents a challenge to open up his protectionist economy.
title: Milei Scores Trump Trade Deal That Will Test His Closed Economy

author: Josh Wingrove
description: Donald Trump said he would ask the Justice Department to investigate Jeffrey Epstein’s ties to former President Bill Clinton, onetime Treasury Secretary Larry Summers, Democratic megadonor Reid Hoffman, and JPMorgan Chase & Co. after new emails prompted questions about the current president’s own relationship with the disgraced financier.
title: Trump Seeks Probe of Epstein Ties to JPMorgan, Summers, Clinton

author: Laura Nahmias, Nacha Cattan
description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul is considering raising corporate taxes as part of broader efforts to close a potential budget shortfall and help fund some of Zohran Mamdani’s agenda as New York City mayor, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.
title: NY Governor Weighs Corporate Tax Hike to Help Fund Mamdani Plans

author: Fumbuka Ng'Wanakilala
description: Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan announced the creation of a panel to investigate the violence that erupted during the east African nation’s Oct. 29 elections.
title: Tanzania Leader Appoints Panel to Probe Deadly Election Violence

author: Erik Hertzberg
description: Canada’s budget watchdog is skeptical Prime Minister Mark Carney’s government will fulfill one of its key fiscal pledges.
title: Canada Budget Watchdog Doubts Carney Can Fulfill Deficit Promise

author: Amanda Albright, Janet Lorin, Liam Knox
description: Bank of America Corp. provided a letter of credit for Harvard University, a step required by the Trump administration for it to participate in the federal student aid program after officials alleged the US’s richest school is in a position of financial instability.
title: Harvard Gets a $36 Million BofA Guarantee That Trump Demanded

author: Foster Wong
description: China’s Foreign Ministry urged its citizens to avoid traveling to Japan due to what it called comments by Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi on Taiwan that pose “major risks” to safety of Chinese nationals.
title: China Warns Citizens to Avoid Traveling to Japan Amid Taiwan Row

author: Allyson Versprille
description: The US Transportation Department is abandoning an effort started by the Biden administration to require airlines to provide meals, hotels and cash payouts to passengers affected by significant flight disruptions.
title: Trump Administration Ditches Plan to Compensate Stranded Flyers

author: Heidi Taksdal Skjeseth, Andreina Itriago
description: The Norwegian Nobel Committee says Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado will travel to Oslo next month to receive her peace prize in person, defying Nicolás Maduro’s crackdown and risking her reentry into the nation.
title: Venezuela’s Machado to Attend Nobel Ceremony Despite Maduro’s Crackdown

author: Josh Wingrove, Kate Sullivan, Bastian Benrath-Wright, Hugo Miller
description: The US and Switzerland have “essentially” reached a trade agreement to lower tariffs on Swiss goods from 39% to 15%, and the White House plans to reveal details on Friday, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said.
title: US to Cut Tariffs on Swiss Goods to 15% in Breakthrough Deal

author: Andrea Palasciano, Michael Nienaber
description: A group of European defense ministers vowed to step up cooperation on countering hybrid threats — including from drones, cyberattacks and disinformation — as disruptions from unmanned aerial vehicles become a near-daily occurrence across the continent.
title: European Defense Ministers to Step Up Over New Hybrid Threats

author: Slav Okov
description: Bulgaria seized control of Lukoil PJSC’s local refinery to head off a potential fuel crisis from US sanctions on the Russian oil firm.
title: Bulgaria Seizes Refinery Before US Sanctions Hit Russia’s Lukoil

author: Josh Wingrove
description: The White House will unveil fresh tariff exemptions designed to address high food prices on Friday, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said, as President Donald Trump’s administration confronts rising political pressure from voters.
title: US to Unveil Tariff Exclusions as Voters Rage Over Food Costs

author: Leah Nylen, Skylar Woodhouse
description: The US Justice Department closed a years-long antitrust probe into the meatpacking industry during the Covid-19 pandemic just weeks before President Donald Trump demanded a fresh investigation, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: DOJ Closed Meat Probe Just Before Trump’s Investigation Demand

author: Zoe Tillman
description: The Justice Department has been discussing settlements with two former officials from Donald Trump’s first term who — like the president — claim they’re owed major payouts from the US government as victims of politically-motivated actions.
title: Michael Flynn, DOJ in Settlement Talks Over $50 Million Claim

author: Josh Wingrove, Kate Sullivan, Bastian Benrath-Wright
description: The US and Switzerland have “essentially” reached a trade agreement to lower tariffs on Swiss goods from 39% to 15%, and the White House plans to reveal details on Friday, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said.
title: US to Lower Tariffs on Swiss Goods to 15% in Breakthrough Deal

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Iran is ignoring international calls to cooperate with the United Nations atomic watchdog and restart nuclear talks with the US, diplomats said, months into a tense stand off following Israeli-led airstrikes on the Islamic Republic.
title: Iran Block on Nuclear Monitoring Deepens Post-Strike Standoff

author: Katarina Hoije
description: A rift in Senegal’s ruling coalition risks overshadowing key International Monetary Fund talks and a potential debt restructuring, after the government uncovered billions of dollars in hidden borrowing.
title: Power Rift in Senegal Overshadows IMF Talks Over Hidden Debt

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will extend the freeze to income-tax thresholds at the budget but will not lower them, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Reeves to Freeze Rather Than Lower UK Income-Tax Thresholds

author: Paul Wallace
description: Top of the Crown Prince’s priorities is a defense deal to bolster Saudi security.
title: MBS Has a List of Big Asks for Donald Trump in DC

author: Ani Avetisyan
description: Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan said his country is in discussions with the US over granting a decades-long lease to develop a regional infrastructure project as part of a process to end years of conflict with neighboring Azerbaijan.
title: Armenia Mulls Lease of Up to 99 Years With US for Trump Corridor

author: Dana Khraiche, Weilun Soon, Alex Longley
description: Iranian forces seized an oil tanker sailing in the Gulf of Oman, diverting the vessel toward the country’s territorial waters on Friday after it passed the Strait of Hormuz, a US defense official said.
title: Iranian Forces Seize Oil Tanker After It Passes Strait of Hormuz

author: Linda Lew
description: China issued new restrictions on exports of used vehicles, closing a loophole that had previously allowed traders to ship new cars into overseas markets under the guise that they were second-hand.
title: China Cracks Down on Exports of Used Cars That Are Actually New

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: The promise of change is spurring cautious optimism among Bolivians during the first days of President Rodrigo Paz’s administration.
title: A Clock Running Clockwise Marks End of Leftist Regime in Bolivia

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: La promesa de cambio ha generado un optimismo cauteloso entre los bolivianos durante los primeros días del mandato del presidente Rodrigo Paz.
title: El adiós al “reloj del Sur” marca el fin del régimen de izquierda en Bolivia

author: Sotiris Nikas, Lizzy Burden
description: Greece is exploring bringing forward an already early repayment of some of its bailout-era loans, Finance Minister Kyriakos Pierrakakis said.
title: Greece Weighs Further Early Repayment of Some Bailout Loans

author: Antonia Mufarech
description: Padre de nueve hijos e inspirado por Orbán y Bolsonaro, encabeza las encuestas presidenciales con un mensaje de orden, austeridad y expulsión de migrantes indocumentados.
title: José Antonio Kast, el nacionalista cristiano que promete salvar a Chile de la izquierda

author: Andras Gergely
description: The US administration is set to support Hungary if the forint comes under attack by speculators, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said Friday.
title: Orban Says US Set to Help if There’s a Run on Hungary’s Forint

author: Kamil Kowalcze
description: Net new borrowing by Germany’s federal government will be €8 billion ($9.3 billion) more than originally planned next year, according to the draft 2026 budget signed off by lawmakers on Friday.
title: Germany Lifts Planned Net New Borrowing for 2026 by €8 Billion

author: Jenny Leonard
description: The US and China are still negotiating over the key details of how Beijing will free up sales of rare earths, according to a person familiar with the matter, weeks after a trade truce that Washington said would pave the way for increased exports.
title: China and US Still to Agree on Rare Earth Deal Weeks After Talks

author: Kamran Haider, Tooba Khan
description: Two Supreme Court judges in Pakistan resigned hours after the country’s parliament approved amendments to the constitution that cut the powers of the judiciary and further empowered the army chief.
title: Pakistan’s Top Court Judges Resign After Move to Cut Its Power

author: Antonia Mufarech
description: José Antonio Kast, a father of nine and ally of Orbán and Bolsonaro, wants to expel undocumented migrants to make Chile safe again.
title: Anti-Crime, Anti-Migrant Pitch Boosts Chilean Christian Nationalist Kast

author: James Woolcock
description: Callum Parr has been taking part in strikes for the past three years, his whole professional life.
title: Striking Doctors Are a Pain for the Man Tipped to Lead Britain

author: Alaric Nightingale
description: Ukrainian drones attacked Russia’s giant Black Sea port of Novorossiysk overnight, causing a fire at an oil terminal, as Moscow launched a massive air strike on Kyiv that killed four and damaged several residential buildings.
title: Ukraine Hits Russian Black-Sea Oil Terminal as Kyiv Attacked

author: Yusuke Maekawa, Shoko Oda
description: A Japanese regional governor who holds sway over the fate of the world’s largest nuclear power plant said security measures at the idled facility had improved since his last visit.
title: Japan’s Biggest Nuclear Plant Must Wait Longer for Restart Nod

author: Chandra Asmara
description: The future of Indonesia’s new national capital city Nusantara was dealt another blow after a constitutional court struck down a provision that would have extended land-right uses to the government for almost 200 years.
title: Indonesia Court Ruling Deals Fresh Blow to New Capital Nusantara

author: Sam Dagher, Fiona MacDonald, Josh Wingrove, Eric Martin
description: The visit to Washington will be a culmination of weeks of tense talks on security, technology and Israel between Saudi and American officials.
title: Saudi Prince to Meet With Trump in US After Weeks of Tense Talks

author: Josh Wingrove, Soo-Hyang Choi
description: The US and South Korea are in private negotiations to jointly build nuclear-powered submarines for both navies, a potential major shift in their alliance that would go beyond the announcement made by the countries’ presidents two weeks ago, people familiar with the matter say.
title: US, S. Korea Discuss Jointly Building Nuclear-Powered Submarines

author: Sakura Murakami, Takashi Hirokawa
description: Japanese businesses are focusing too much on shareholders, Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi said Friday, adding that she hopes to see more company wealth distributed to employees.
title: Japan’s Takaichi Says Firms Focusing Too Much on Shareholders

author: Swati Gupta
description: Vote counting began Friday in Bihar — India’s poorest yet one of its most politically significant states — in an election seen as a key test of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s popularity after a year marred by economic headwinds and foreign policy challenges.
title: India’s Poorest State Begins Vote Count in Crucial Test for Modi

author: Colum Murphy, Sakura Murakami
description: China demanded that Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi retract a remark about a possible conflict over Taiwan while an official newspaper called it Tokyo’s first threat of force against China in 80 years, as a diplomatic spat between the two Asian nations escalated.
title: China Demands Japan’s Takaichi Retract ‘Dangerous’ Taiwan Remark

author: Augusta Saraiva, Eric Martin
description: Brazil hopes to reach a preliminary trade deal with the US as soon as this month, the South American nation’s top diplomat said, as relations between the two countries improve after a months-long feud.
title: Brazil Sees Provisional US Trade Deal Soon as Relations Improve

author: Ram Anand
description: Thailand and Cambodia are committed to finding a peaceful resolution to their border conflict, with Malaysia offering to facilitate talks towards peace, Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said on Thursday.
title: Thailand, Cambodia Committed to Resolve Border Clash, Says Anwar
